sentences.english: Nobody has paid a visit to that grave for a long time, so it is covered in weeds.
sentences.chinese: 那座坟丘因为好久没人祭扫，上面长满了野草。

sentences.english: Unlike a skyscraper, your garden will grow weeds.
sentences.chinese: 和摩天大楼不同，你的花园会长出野草。

sentences.english: And the long grass o'ertops the moldering wall.
sentences.chinese: 长长的野草遮盖著败瓦。

sentences.english: She came across butchered hedges and flowerbeds choked with weeds.
sentences.chinese: 她发现树篱被糟蹋，花坛里野草丛生。

sentences.english: An abandoned military road, overgrown with weeds, marked the former boundary line.
sentences.chinese: 一条长满野草的废弃军用公路标示出以前的边界线。

sentences.english: Do not let weeds grow under your dreaming.
sentences.chinese: 不要让你的梦想阆苑野草生长。

sentences.english: Later that evening, I began pulling weeds from around my lopsided azalea bush.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，我在那丛不对称的杜鹃花丛旁边拔除野草。

sentences.english: People searched garbage dumps for food or ate weeds.
sentences.chinese: 人们去垃圾桶中寻找食物或者干脆吃野草。

sentences.english: Her long hair was befouled by weeds and sticks.
sentences.chinese: 她的长头发被野草和枯枝缠住了。

sentences.english: Striga is a parasitic weed that Africans commonly call witchweed.
sentences.chinese: 斯特赖加是一种寄生野草，非洲人通常称其为独角金。

sentences.english: The weeds were abloom with tiny purple blossoms.
sentences.chinese: 野草正开满著纤小的紫花。

sentences.english: The reason why Lu Xun named his essay collections of "wild grass" is by no means accidental.
sentences.chinese: 散文诗集《野草》被鲁迅命名为“野草”绝非偶然。

sentences.english: The reason why Lu Xun named his essay collections of "wild grass" is by no means accidental.
sentences.chinese: 散文诗集《野草》被鲁迅命名为“野草”绝非偶然。

sentences.english: After harvest today, I wanted to do some weeding.
sentences.chinese: 今天收耕完时，我突然好想拔野草。

sentences.english: The fields were thick with wild green grass and bursts of yellow flowers.
sentences.chinese: 田地里长满了茂密的野草，盛开着黄色的花朵。

sentences.english: The tall grasses undulated like eels under the north wind.
sentences.chinese: 长高的野草在寒风中象鳗鲡似的蠕蠕游动。
